title: How to Tag Someone on WhatsApp on Android

steps.title: Launch the WhatsApp app on your Android phone or tablet.
steps.content: Launch the WhatsApp app on your Android phone or tablet. It's the green chat bubble icon with a white phone receiver in the app drawer.

steps.title: If you don't see the group you're looking for, you can search for it by name.
steps.content: If you don't see the group you're looking for, you can search for it by name. Tap the magnifying glass icon at the top of the screen, then type the group's name. You'll be able to select it from the search results.

steps.title: Tap Type a Message to open the keyboard.
steps.content: Tap Type a Message to open the keyboard. It's in the text box at the bottom of the chat.

steps.title: Tap ?123 on the keyboard.
steps.content: Tap ?123 on the keyboard. It's at the keyboard's bottom-left edge. If you don't see that key, look for one that says “Sym” or “@123” instead.

steps.title: Tap the @ key on the keyboard.
steps.content: Tap the @ key on the keyboard. A list of group members will appear.

steps.title: You may have to scroll down the list to find the right person.
steps.content: You may have to scroll down the list to find the right person. The person's name will now appear after the “@” symbol in the text box. You can tag multiple people using this method.

steps.title: Tap the Send icon.
steps.content: Tap the Send icon. It's the green icon with a white paper airplane on the right side of the text box. The tag(s) will now appear in the group chat.
